document_data.name: ''Fine at Home: A Cookery Book''
document_data.mainbody: '''''Fine at Home: A Cookery Book''''' was a cook[[book]] for those of means from the city of [[Baldur's Gate]], printed sometime in or before the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Contents: The cookbook was written to be used in kitchens staffed with numerous servants and cooks. One of the recipes featured in the book was [[A Feast for a Tenday]], a dish that required two days of cooking a complex sauce with roasted [[pork]] and was served with [[pasta]], hard salty [[cheese]]s, hard-boiled [[egg]]s, and a side salad.
document_data.History: By the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, ''Fine at Home: A Cookery Book'' could be found in the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of Baldur's Gate. A copy belonged to Chef [[Marjoram (chef)|Marjoram]] and the kitchen staff of Lady [[Firelia Jannath]] in her Lower City estate.
